author: hustla187
title: Cool Plane
review: I really like the planes that hold one minifig in it. This is a good example of that. The colors of the plane are very nice and makes it look good too. The minifig with the sticks is pretty cool too. A good set to get if you can find it.

author: petro17sq
title: Classic
review:
I love this set.
Actualy I bougth this year cargo plane only because it remained me about this set.
It comes with 2 minifigures, one rich minifigure that own the small plane and a controller that work in the yellow airport.
it is a small set but it look great!

author: AETerry
title: Turbo Prop I Review
review:
I recieve this set from my Aunt as part of a group of lego sets that were incomplete and missing pieces... As such I don't feel I've ever gotten to properly enjoy this set the way it's meant to be.

 

It's a fun little build if you like airplanes, two minifigures, a pilot and ground control/direction. It has a good constrast of colors and solid build. Just never having much of a Lego Airfield or Airport, this set was always a bit out of place for me.

author: AstroTech
title: A true classic.
review:
This set has some special value to me. Living in the GDR in 1988, it was not easy to get LEGO sets. But for christmas and birthdays our relatives in Western Germany used to send us so-called "Westpakete", big packages with all sorts of stuff from there. They often contained fruit like bananas and oranges, "Milka" chocolate, clothes etc., and that year, I got such a package for my seventh birthday. This contained this LEGO set. I was very much into planes and helicopters anyway, so this was double joy. This little plane instantly became my favourite toy and since then.
This all-5 review might be heavily influenced by nostalgic feelings, but the set still looks classic and very well designed today. It is definitely a must for every airport or other aviation-themed LEGO setting.

author: goldenbane
title: My first aeroplane set!
review: This was the first aeroplane set I ever got as a kid.  There's so much playability in this set, from the little pilot who seems to be more of a businessman or normal guy, to the guy who guides the plane in for a landing!  A very simple set, but great!
